name: cfdocument
description: Creates PDF or FlashPaper output from a text block containing CFML and HTML.

params.name: format
params.description: Specifies the report format.

params.name: filename
params.description:
Specifies the fully qualified path name of a file to
 contain the PDF or FlashPaper output. If you omit the
 filename attribute, ColdFusion MX streams output to
 the browser.

params.name: localurl
params.description:
Specifies whether to retrieve image files directly 
 from the local drive:
 * yes: ColdFusion retrieves image files directly from 
 the local drive rather than by using HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy.
 * no: ColdFusion uses HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy to retrieve 
 image files even if the files are stored locally.

params.name: overwrite
params.description:
Specifies whether ColdFusion MX overwrites an
 existing file. Used in conjunction with filename.
 Default is: false

params.name: name
params.description:
Specifies the name of an existing variable into which
 the tag stores the PDF or FlashPaper output.

params.name: pagetype
params.description:
Specifies the page size into which ColdFusion
 generates the report.
 - legal: 8.5 inches x 14 inches
 - letter: 8.5 inches x 11 inches
 - A4: 8.27 inches x 11.69 inches
 - A5: 5.81 inches x 8.25 inches
 - B5: 9.81 inches x 13.88 inches
 - Custom: Custom height and width.
 If you specify custom, you must also specify the pageheight
 and pagewidth attributes, can optionally specify margin
 attributes, and can optionally specify whether the units
 are inches or centimeters.

params.name: pageheight
params.description:
Specifies the page height in inches (default) or
 centimeters. This attribute is only valid if
 pagetype=custom. To specify page height in
 centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

params.name: pagewidth
params.description:
Specifies the page width in inches (default) or
 centimeters. This attribute is only valid if
 pagetype=custom. To specify page width in
 centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

params.name: orientation
params.description:
Specifies the page orientation. Specify either of the
 following:
 - portrait (default)
 - landscape

params.name: margintop
params.description:
Specifies the top margin in inches (default) or
 centimeters. To specify top margin in centimeters,
 include the unit=cm attribute.

params.name: marginbottom
params.description:
Specifies the bottom margin in inches (default) or
 centimeters. To specify bottom margin in
 centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

params.name: marginleft
params.description:
Specifies the left margin in inches (default) or
 centimeters. To specify left margin in centimeters,
 include the unit=cm attribute.

params.name: marginright
params.description:
Specifies the right margin in inches (default) or
 centimeters. To specify right margin in centimeters,
 include the unit=cm attribute.

params.name: unit
params.description:
Specifies the default unit (inches or centimeters) for
 pageheight, pagewidth, and margin attributes.

params.name: encryption
params.description:
Specifies whether the output is encrypted (format="PDF" only).
 Default is: none

params.name: ownerpassword
params.description: Specifies an owner password (format="PDF" only).

params.name: userpassword
params.description: Specifies a user password (format="PDF" only).

params.name: permissions
params.description:
Specifies one or more permissions (format="PDF" only).
 Separate multiple permissions with a comma.

params.name: fontembed
params.description:
Specifies whether ColdFusion embeds fonts in the output.
 Specify one of the following:
 - true: Embed fonts
 - false: Do not embed fonts.
 Selective: Embed all fonts except Java fonts and core fonts.

params.name: backgroundvisible
params.description:
Specifies whether the background prints when the
 user prints the document:
 - yes: include the background when printing.
 - no: do not include the background when printing.

params.name: scale
params.description:
Specifies a scale factor as a percentage. Use this
 option to reduce the size of the HTML output so that
 it fits on that paper. Specify a number less than 100.

params.name: authpassword
params.description:
Password sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. 
Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. 
Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

params.name: authuser
params.description:
User name sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. 
Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. 
Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

params.name: bookmark
params.description:
Specifies whether bookmarks are created in the document:
 * yes: creates bookmarks.
 * no: does not create bookmarks.

params.name: localurl
params.description:
Specifies whether to retrieve image files directly from the local drive:
 * yes: ColdFusion retrieves image files directly from the local drive rather than by using HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy.
 * no: ColdFusion uses HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy to retrieve image files even if the files are stored locally.

params.name: mimetype
params.description: MIME type of the source document

params.name: proxypassword
params.description: Password required by the proxy server.

params.name: proxyuser
params.description: User name to provide to the proxy server.

params.name: saveasname
params.description: (format="PDF" only) The filename that appears in the SaveAs dialog when a user saves a PDF file written to the browser.

params.name: src
params.description:
URL or the relative path to the web root. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes. 
The file must be in a browser-writable format such as, HTML, HTM, BMP, PNG, and so on.

params.name: srcfile
params.description:
Absolute path of a file that is on the server. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes. 
The file must be in a browser-writable format such as, HTML, HTM, BMP, PNG, and so on.

params.name: useragent
params.description: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

params.name: proxyhost
params.description: IP address or server name for proxy host.

params.name: proxyport
params.description: port of the proxy host.

params.name: tagged
params.description: Determines if PDF are created by using special tags also known as Tagged PDF

params.name: pdfa
params.description: Creates a PDF of type PDF/A-1 (ISO 19005-1:2005)

params.name: formFields
params.description: Specifies whether form fields are exported as widgets or only their fixed print representation is exported.

params.name: formsType
params.description: Specifies the submitted format of a PDF form.

params.name: permissionsPassword
params.description: This is the password that allows the user to access some permissions restricted if some permissions need to be restricted. The permissions are defined in "permissions" attribute

params.name: openPassword
params.description: If the source document is protected specify using this attribute.

examples.title: Dynamic PDF Served to Browser
examples.description: PDF is sent back to the browser instead of saving to a file. The cfheader tag is used to suggest a file name to the browser. The cfcontent tag is used to set the Content-Type response header (that could also be done using cfheader) which tells the browser that it is a PDF file.
examples.code:
Hello ColdFusion

This is PDF example document.

Genereated at: #TimeFormat(Now())# on #DateFormat(Now())#
